thread.title: Residents speak of their shock after shots fired during Old Trafford funeral wake
thread.title_full: Residents speak of their shock after shots fired during Old Trafford funeral wake

author: John Scheerhout
title: Residents speak of their shock after shots fired during Old Trafford funeral wake
text:
Residents speak of their shock after shots fired during Old Trafford funeral wake Police have stepped up patrols in Old Trafford after gunfire outside the church social centre Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Police at the scene of a shooting at a wake in Old Trafford Share this video Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A wake ended in a brawl and shots being fired outside a church community hall, according to residents. 
A number of shots were fired near the fire exit of St Alphonsus Parish Centre in Old Trafford at the end of the party. 
Police have started an investigation into the shooting and patrols have been stepped up. 
The large centre, situated at the rear St Alphonsus Roman Catholic Church, has a downstairs bar and a dance floor, and regularly hosts bingo nights and private functions. Read More Shocking injuries of gran attacked by thug who stole wedding ring and said she 'wouldn't get out alive' 
Residents reported hearing at least two bangs following the shooting incident shortly before midnight on Wednesday. 
They say the centre was hosting a rowdy wake following a funeral service but that noise from the event had died down by the time the shooting happened. 
One resident, who declined to be named, said: “I’m just glad nobody got hurt. It’s a shock. There are families with children and elderly people in this street. It really worries you that something like this can happen on your doorstep. Read More 
“It had been quite noisy but the noise had calmed down by the time this happened. To me it sounded like the clanking of metal. There’s been fighting outside the hall before but never anything like this.” 
Another householder said: “I heard a couple of bangs. It can get pretty rowdy over there.” 
Police were called to Alphonsus Street in Old Trafford shortly before 11.55pm on Wednesday to reports that a group of men were fighting at the social club. 
When officers arrived, they learned a gun had been fired ‘a number’ of bullets were recovered near to the fire exit door. Read More 
No-one was injured. 
The bullets are being forensically analysed to identify the gun. 
Detective Chief Inspector Paul Parker said: “We are treating this as a serious incident and have therefore increased patrols in the area so you will see extra officers out and about. 
“We believe this is an isolated incident and there is no wider threat to the public. 
“If you have any concerns, or suspect something suspicious, then please approach one of our officers or call police. We will always try and assist in any way we can.” 
To pass on information call GMP on 101 quoting reference number 2527 of 1 February 2017 or ring Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555 111. Like us on Facebook
